newsitem.title: UK: Air imports strong in December - Mitsubishi.
newsitem.headline: Air imports strong in December - Mitsubishi.

text.p: The index of future U.S. air cargo business dropped 0.3 percent to 528.0 in December, compared to a 0.2 percent gain in November, the Bank of Tokyo-Mitsubishi said.

In its latest Foreign Trade survey of air freight carriers, seaports and trucking firms released here, the bank quoted a major carrier executive as saying that expectations were based on normal operations but if the American Airlines strike occurs then the outlook would change dramatically.
A foreign based air cargo executive was quoted as saying the weakening of the Japanese yen "will slow U.S. exports to Japan" over the coming months.

The bank's New York economic research department figures released Thursday show the index of air cargo trade activity, rose by 1.9 percent in December to 471.2 following a 3.9 percent rise in November.
The December index of air cargo export business was up 0.6 percent to 597.7 whilst that for import business was down 0.3 percent at 405.7.
There was an increase in the current air cargo import conditions which gained 2.5 percent. Export conditions rose 1.4 percent.
Air cargo export expectations increased 0.3 percent at 649.4 while import expectations decreased by 1.3 percent to 406.8.
The air cargo trade activity indices are equally weighted composite index of current export and import activity (not seasonally adjusted with 1989=100).

The air cargo import diffusion index for December stood at 57.7 percent, which was the highest December reading since 1989 when that survey question was first reported. - Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax:5017
